subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Without a sack or interception in the last nine quarters, the San Diego Chargers fired the defensive coordinator Ted Cottrell and replaced him with Ron Rivera, the inside linebackers coach. Cottrell had become a popular target of fan anger as the Chargers (3-5) lost three of their last four games, including a 37-32 loss to the Saints in London on Sunday. ¶Defensive end Bruce Smith, defensive back Rod Woodson and tight end Shannon Sharpe are among first-year candidates for induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame. The list includes 110 players, 7 coaches and 16 contributors, including Paul Tagliabue, the former N.F.L. commissioner, and the longtime team owners Bud Adams, Jerry Jones, Art Modell and Ralph Wilson. Hall of Fame selectors will announce the 25 semifinalists later this month.
